intro: Espeletia conglomerata var. macroclada, commonly known as the large-flowered espeletia, is a striking plant native to the Andean highlands of South America. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and large, showy flower heads that can reach up to 30 centimeters in diameter. The plant thrives in high-altitude environments, often found in cloud forests and páramo ecosystems. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, and they bloom in late summer and early autumn. This species is well adapted to cold, dry conditions and is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value.
